clinical_validity.disease_label: neurodevelopmental disorder with nonspecific brain abnormalities and with or without seizures
clinical_validity.gcep: Brain Malformations Gene Curation Expert Panel

generif.text: Delta-1 can enhance myeloid and lymphoid marrow-repopulating ability and promote the generation of thymus-repopulating T cell precursors.
suppresses the self-renewal capacity and long-term growth of two myeloblastic leukemia cell lines
Dll1 is a substrate for regulated intramembrane proteolysis, and its intracellular region possibly fulfills a specific function in the nucleus
Delta and Jagged undergo ADAM-mediated ectodomain processing followed by PS-mediated intramembrane proteolysis to release signaling fragments
induces a NIH 3T3 cell tranformed phenotype mediated by FGF signaling.
Delta-1 and Jagged-1 have roles in growth suppression in two myeloid leukemia cell lines
Notch ligand, Delta-1, reduced the TNF-alpha-induced growth suppression and apoptosis in U937 cells.
Down-regulation of Notch-1, Delta-like-1, or Jagged-1 by RNA interference induces apoptosis and inhibits proliferation in multiple glioma cell lines.
Density of the Notch ligand Delta1 determines generation of B and T cell precursors from hematopoietic stem cells.
When a dominant-negative form of kuzmanian in transgenic mice impairs Notch signaling in receiving T-cells, increasing Delta-1 on sending cells overcomes this defect.
Dll1 is presented on the surface of AJs formed at the apical termini of processes through interaction with MAGI1 to activate Notch on neighboring cells in the developing central nervous system
culture with increased amounts of Delta1(ext-IgG) induced apoptosis of CD34+ precursors resulting in decreased cell numbers, without affecting generation of CD7+ cells
The expression of the intracellular domain of Delta1 results in a non-proliferating senescent-like cell phenotype which is dependent on the expression of the cell cycle inhibitor, p21.
Data describe the immunohistochemical staining pattern of four Notch receptors (Notch1-4) and their ligands (Delta1 and Jagged1) in synovial tissues obtained from rheumatoid arthritis patients.
DL1-induced activation of the Notch1 pathway controls the lineage commitment of early thymic precursors by altering the levels between Spi-B and GATA-3.

Dll1 was expressed in arterial endothelial cells, not venous Ecs or capillaries. Notch signaling by induction of Dll1 is necessary & sufficient to regulate ephrin-B2 expression & EphB2- & EphB4-dependent branching morphogenesis in arterial EC.
with supervised resistance exercise training, expression of Notch1 and Hes6 genes were increased and Delta-like 1 and Numb expression were decreased.

Tbx18 interacts with Gata4 and Nkx2-5 and competes Tbx5-mediated activation of the cardiac Natriuretic peptide precursor type a-promoter. Tbx18 down-regulates Tbx6-activated Delta-like 1 expression in the somitic mesoderm in vivo
Notch ligand Delta-1 enhances the sIL-6R-mediated effects of IL-6 on the generation of erythroid cells.
Report the antitumor effects of COX2 inhibitors may be associated with effects on the Delta1/Notch1 pathway in colon tumor cells.
The intracellular region of Notch ligands Dll1 and Dll3 regulates their trafficking and signaling activity
Delta1 and Jagged1 are expressed in human umbilical cord epithelial cells at the mRNA and protein level.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
DLL1 was found downregulated in immune thrombocytopenic purpura.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Findings suggest a positive feedback loop between Notch1 and DLL1 in the U251MG glioma cell line.
these results suggest a link between Dll1 expression and human goblet cell differentiation that might be mediated by a function that is distinct from its role as a Notch receptor ligand.

revealed a striking difference between the responses of Notch to trans- and cis-Delta: whereas the response to trans-Delta is graded, the response to cis-Delta is sharp and occurs at a fixed threshold, independent of trans-Delta
Delta1 protein is involved in the cytodifferentiation of squamous odontogenic tumors of the mandible.

Relapse-free survival and overall survival showed a significantly shorter survival in acute myeloid leukemia patients with higher Notch1 expression, higher Jagged1 expression, or higher Delta1 expression.
findings implicate DLL1 in early patterning of the forebrain and identify NOTCH as a new signaling pathway involved in Holoprosencephaly.
In this study, Delta 1 ligand was detected in the lining epithelium of human periapical cysts with limited inflammation, showing Notch pathway activation in those cells.
we have investigated their influence on early human hematopoiesis and show that Jagged2 affects hematopoietic lineage decisions very similarly as Delta-like-1 and -4, but very different from Jagged1
growth rate of Delta1-deficient dental pulp stem cells was significantly suppressed as compared with wild type cells
The stromal cell-mediated antiapoptotic effect on B- ALL cells is mediated by Notch-3 and -4 or Jagged-1/-2 and DLL-1 in a synergistic manner.
Notch1 and its ligand Delta-like 1(DLL1) are miR-449 bona fide targets
regulates Notch1 signaling through disruption of the Notch1-IC-RBP-Jk transcription activator complex
The receptors Notch2, -3, -4 and their ligands Jagged1, -2 and Delta1, -4 were detected at both the mRNA and protein level in early and late placenta
DLL1, which encodes Delta-like 1, the ligand for Notch3, is strongly implicated as the chromosome 6q27 Visceral leishmaniasis susceptibility gene.

as compared to MSC, OP9 cells were more efficient at inducing self-renewal and/or de novo generation of primitive (CD34(+) CD38(-) Lin(-)) cells, and suggest that such effects were due, at least in part, to the presence of Jagged-1 and DL1.
MiR-34a targeting of Notch ligand delta-like 1 impairs CD15+/CD133+ tumor-propagating cells and supports neural differentiation in medulloblastoma
An anti-delta1 Notch protein-blocking monoclonal antibody is able to prolong allograft survival in a fully histocompatibility-mismatched model of cardiac transplantation.
Notch1, Jagged1, and Delta1 expressions might be useful markers for clinical prognosis of ovarian carcinomas.
Dll1 and Notch interaction accelerates multiple myeloma disease development by promoting CD138+ MM-cell proliferation.

Twenty-one SNPs were genotyped in 941 visceral leishmaniasis cases and 992 controls. Gene expression profiling was done and DLL1 was the only gene to show differential expression that was higher (P<0.0001) in pre- compared to post-treatment samples.
Overexpresion of DLL1 in endothelial cells inhibited cell proliferation, but did not affect cell migration, sprouting angiogenesis or cell adhesion.
MiR-34a reduced cell proliferation and invasiveness, at least, partially through its inhibitory effect on DLL1 in choriocarcinoma.
Data suggest that overexpression of Delta-Like1 (DLL1) in small cell lung cancer may increase the sensitivity of cells to chemotherapeutic agents.
direct measurement of the binding affinity of Notch1 EGF repeats 6-15 for Dll1 and Dll4 revealed that Dll4 binds with at least an order of magnitude higher affinity than Dll1
Synaptojanin-2 binding protein stabilizes the Notch ligands DLL1 and DLL4 and inhibits sprouting angiogenesis.

Although Delta1 activates signal transducer and activator of transcription 3 signaling similarly to the gp130-activating cytokine interleukin-6 (IL-6), it has opposite effects on myeloid cell production.
Notch ligand Dll1 may enhance the adhesion and metastasis of melanoma cells by upregulation of N-cadherin.
Dengue virus up-regulates expression of notch ligands Dll1 and Dll4 through interferon-beta signalling pathway.
Delta-like 1-mediated Notch signaling enhances the in vitro conversion of human memory CD4 T cells into FOXP3-expressing regulatory T cells.
determined the X-ray crystal structure of the extracellular domain of the Notch ligand delta-like ligand-1 (Dll-1)
altered Notch signaling via methylation of DLL1 is likely involved in possible disease-related mechanisms of early onset preeclampsia
High DLL1 levels were associate with reduced exercise capacity and diastolic dysfunction in chronic heart failure patients.
Soluble DLL1 was significantly increased in uterine lavage samples of infertile women compared with fertile women in the secretory phase of the menstrual cycle.

Mir-34a functions as a regulator by decreasing the expression of NOTCH1 and DLL1. Our study is the first to identify a correlation between mir-34a and its target genes NOTCH1 and DLL1 in endometrial adenocarcinoma
DLL1-mediated Notch signaling is critical for proper bone remodeling as it regulates the differentiation and function of both osteoblasts and osteoclasts.

Human Jagged-1 induced the proliferation and differentiation of CD133+ cord blood progenitors compared with hDll-1. Thus, hJagged-1 signaling in the bone marrow niche may be used to expand EPCs for therapeutic angiogenesis

Highly methylated domains containing a putative fetal brain enhancer near DLL1 was found to reach genome-wide significance and was validated for significantly higher methylation in autism spectrum disorders children than in controls.
Gain-of-function and loss-of-function studies demonstrated that miR-130b-3p could inhibit breast carcinoma cell invasion and migration by directly targeting the Notch ligand Delta-like 1 (DLL1).
The DLK1 inhibited the odontoblastic differentiation of hDPSCs, which maybe through ERK signalling pathway.

This study suggested that miR-34a-5p, DLL1 and the ATF2/ATF3/ATF4 signaling pathway-associated genes are the potential diagnostic and/or therapeutic targets for an effective chemotherapy of osteosarcoma.
Circulating levels of DLL1 and POSN were higher in patients with severe dilated cardiomyopathy and correlated with the degree of diastolic dysfunction.

Neuroblastoma cells were transfected with miRNA-34 family members, and the effect of miRNAs transfection on DLL1 mRNA expression levels, on cell differentiation, proliferation and apoptosis was measured

the effects of two Notch ligands, i.e., Jagged1 and DLL1, on murine and human hematopoiesis in vitro. Our observations indicate that the stromal expression of Notch ligands increases the production of both the total and phenotypically early murine and human hematopoietic cells in the co-culture.

This study produced recombinant DLL1-DE3, a novel soluble form of DLL1 protein, which contains the DSL domain and EGF1-3 repeats critical for Notch pathway activation. Cellular assays revealed recombinant DLL1-DE3 was biologically active as it increased expression of Notch-dependent genes in inducible pluripotent and breast cancer cells.
Abnormal DLL1 methylation and expression observed in early gastric lesions and in gastric cancers may be relevant to the pathogenesis of gastric cancer.
DLL1 locus was marginally associated with TgAb levels in females.
CSF DLL1, VDBP and fetuin exhibited fair diagnostic performance for TBM diagnosis
miR-34a contributes to chondrocyte death, causing Osteoarthritis progression through DLL1 and modulation of the PI3K/AKT pathway.
It has been demonstrated that DLL1-dependent Notch signaling and GM-CSF cooperate to promote human dendritic cell differentiation.
DLL1-mediated Notch signaling promotes luminal breast cancer
This study reveals NFIA as a pro-endocrine factor in the pancreas, acting to repress Mib1, inhibit Dll1 endocytosis and thus promote escape from Notch activation.

The dissimilar effects of DLL1 downregulation observed amongst MCF-7, BT474, and MDA-MB-231 cells is likely due to their distinctive genetic and biologic characteristics, suggesting that DLL1 contributes to breast cancer through various mechanisms
Knockdown of DLL1 could promote the cardiomyocyte differentiation.

DLL1 is a novel host-derived biomarker for the diagnosis of sepsis with a better performance compared to established ones, most likely due to its high robustness in non-infectious inflammatory responses.
The potential mechanism of miR-130b on promotion of the invasion and metastasis of hepatocellular carcinoma by inhibiting Notch-Dll1.

DLL1 is a potent suppressor of pancreatic cancer metastasis. Understanding correlation between expression and function of DLL1 might contribute to our knowledge of the complicated mechanism of pancreatic cancer metastasis.
Association of DLL1 with type 1 diabetes in patients characterized by low polygenic risk score.
Association Between Soluble Notch Ligand Delta-like Ligand 1 and Bleeding Complications in Patients With Dengue Fever Infection.
Terminal 6q deletions cause brain malformations, a phenotype mimicking heterozygous DLL1 pathogenic variants: A multicenter retrospective case series.
Activation of NOTCH signaling via DLL1 is mediated by APE1-redox-dependent NF-kappaB activation in oesophageal adenocarcinoma.
The phenotypic spectrum of terminal 6q deletions based on a large cohort derived from social media and literature: a prominent role for DLL1.

summary: DLL1 is a human homolog of the Notch Delta ligand and is a member of the delta/serrate/jagged family.  It plays a role in mediating cell fate decisions during hematopoiesis. It may play a role in cell-to-cell communication. [provided by RefSeq, Jul 2008].
